moves.1. d4: My opponent opens with d4.  I myself use the queen's gambit when white so I feel that this is a strong opening move.
moves.2. Nc3 e6 3. h4: h4? white's first questionable move.  Now, I'm sure theres a purpose to this, but I don't see it.. maybe to defend his bishop soon to be on g5, but his bishop stays put costing white a tempo.
moves.3... c5: As I mentioned before I use the queen's gambit so I am now in a position I am very comfortable in as black.
moves.4. Na4 b6: White's knight is not threatening to me, and allows me to free up my light squared bishop without losing tempo.
moves.5. b3 Bd6: Now I can develop without having to worry about his pesky pawns.
moves.6. c4: It looks like he wants to break up the centre, which is fine with me.
moves.6... Nc6 7. e3 Nge7 8. dxc5: I do not feel that this is in his best interest as I am much more developed than him and if we trade off pawns I will have centre control with all my big pieces.
moves.8... bxc5 9. cxd5 Nxd5: Capturing with my knight made it incredibly powerful. Just look at all the dark squares my centre three pieces are attacking.
moves.10... Bb7: A very good spot for my bishop.
moves.11. Nxc5: Nc5??? What a blunder! Trading his only developed piece for an isolated pawn?
moves.11... Bxc5: Just look at my development compared to white's.
moves.12. e4: Should've done that while your knight was still protecting c3.
moves.12... Nc3: Attacking the queen and threatening checkmate.
moves.13. Qxd8+: NOT a good time to trade queens.
moves.13... Rxd8: Now another powerful piece joins the attack! White looks to be in trouble here.
moves.14. Bb2 Nxe4 15. Nf3 Nb4 16. Rc1: He sees my threatened fork, and moves to defend..
moves.16... Nxf2 17. Rg1: .. but he should have moved Rh2..
moves.17... Nfd3+: .. because this three-pronged fork and discovered attack on the rook leaves him in a much worse position than before.
moves.18. Kd1: Now, would you take the bishop or the rook?
moves.18... Nxb2+: The bishop of course, and it soon become clear why.
moves.19. Ke2 Ba6+: Ba6! Forcing the King back to e1.
moves.21. Kd2 Nxc1+ 22. Kxc1 Bxg1 23. Bxa6: With Nxg1 I would win a free bishop on f2..
moves.23... Be3+ 24. Kb2 Nxa6: .. but the result is the same.
moves.25. a4 O-O: Now it is not long before his impending doom.
